item.description:
The next New England United general meeting will be from 1:00 to 4:00 PM on Saturday, 17 January, at:
Encuentro 5
33 Harrison Avenue, 5th Floor
Boston, MA
(Chinatown Stop on the Orange Line T)

The meeting was originally scheduled for 10 January but has been postponed since some of our members are mobilizing for the Gaza demonstration in DC on the tenth.

Ashley Smith will be providing a roundup of the crisis in Gaza and the recent protests around the world, and facilitating a discussion about this critical situation.

The meeting will also feature discussion of the calls for national action on March 21 in DC, and April 4 in NYC, as the occupation of Iraq enters its seventh year. The last general meeting of New England United was in early November, and to date NEU has not endorsed either the March 21 action in DC called by the National Assembly and other coalitions, networks and organizations, or the April 4 action in NYC called by UFPJ at its recent conference in Chicago.

I hope you will join us on Saturday to help us plan for what is destined to be a banner year for the peace movement in New England.

Proposed agenda from the Regional committee:

1:00 - 1:05 Introductions and welcome
1:05 - 1:45 Political forum: Crisis in Gaza (presenter/facilitator: Ashley Smith)
1:45 - 2:00 Reports/discussion: Recent UFPJ conference in Chicago
2:00 - 2:15 Reports/discussion: Majoritarian working group
2:15 - 2:30 Reports/discussion: Conference committee
2:30 - 2:45 Break
2:45 - 3:45 Discussion: Calls for national action on March 21 and April 4
3:45 - 4:00 Announcements, next meeting
4:00 - 5:00 Sub-regional meetings
item.name: New England United regional antiwar coalition general meeting
